alert.note: Alert for Wyoming (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 17 at 10:49PM EST until February 18 at 12:00PM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New York... Cattaraugus Creek At Gowanda affecting Chautauqua, Erie, Cattaraugus and Wyoming Counties. Cazenovia Creek Near Ebenezer affecting Erie County. Cayuga Creek Near Lancaster affecting Wyoming and Erie Counties. Ellicott Creek Near Williamsville affecting Erie and Genesee Counties. Tonawanda Creek At Batavia affecting Wyoming, Erie, Niagara and Genesee Counties. .The following flood warnings are for high flows from rain and snowmelt. Potential ice jams through tonight may result in more significant flooding localized near ice jams. For the Cattaraugus Creek...including Gowanda...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Cazenovia Creek...including Ebenezer...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Cayuga Creek...including Lancaster...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Ellicott Creek...including Williamsville...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Tonawanda Creek...including Attica, Batavia, Rapids...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cayuga Creek Near Lancaster. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Flood stage, minor flooding in low lying areas of Lancaster and Alden. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 PM EST Thursday the stage was 8.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:30 PM EST Thursday was 8.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 8.5 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 8.5 feet on 06/13/2013. - For more information please visit http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Friday morning at 1000 AM EST.
